metadata.title: CVE-2020-10001 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
An input validation issue was addressed with improved memory handling. This issue is fixed in macOS Big Sur 11.1, Security Update 2020-001 Catalina, Security Update 2020-007 Mojave. A malicious application may be able to read restricted memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-10001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-bsd - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-client - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-common - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-core-drivers - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-daemon - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-ipp-utils - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-ppdc - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
cups-server-common - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
libcups2 - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
libcupsimage2 - 2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.3op2-7ubuntu2').
